entry.title: Multi Player CLI Battleship
entry.content:
The multi-player version of the previous article. We were not allowed to use multiple processes for either the client or the server so there was a lot to learn about threading.

I had a lot of fun (and frustration) debugging this program. It wasn’t actually as hard as it initially seemed.

This was the fourth (and final) assigment I did for COMP2303/7306 while getting my Masters of Information Technology at the University of Queensland.

entry.title: Suspect
entry.content:
Suspect, as the program for this assignment was called, taught me multi-process programming and signal-handling.

Its basically an interpreter for a (very) small scripting language. The first line of each scripts opens a child process and each successive line is a command which allows interaction with the child process and the file system.

The most fun I had with it was when I used Suspect to open another instance of itself.

This was the third assigment I did for COMP2303/7306 while getting my Masters of Information Technology at the University of Queensland.

entry.title: Single Player CLI Battleship
entry.content:
By creating a single-player implementation of the well-known game ‘battle ship’, I learned about writing and compiling a C program which interacted with the user and file-system.

This was the first assigment I did for COMP2303/7306 while getting my Masters of Information Technology at the University of Queensland.

entry.title: SineMaster Lite
entry.content:
SineMaster Lite is the result of learning a lot of the features of C# as well as a substantial amount of .NET pertaining to WPF.

After spending a lot of time dissecting Microsoft sample code, I wanted to try my hand at a simple program. This is a milestone to a larger project I planned: a game called SineMaster. In SineMaster, you would be given the image of a waveform and need to reproduce it by combining sine waves.

entry.title: WPF Calculator
entry.content:
Continuing my quest to understand .NET and C#, I refactored out all the XAML from the original sample on MSDN into pure C#.

It is a direct port so uses WPF and follows the same structure of the original program.

entry.title: Computer Systems Workbooks
entry.content:
We had a lab every week to practice the engineering side of the class. The tutors in charge of each session were under orders to be strict about the workbook’s content so that we could learn to be professional. I have scanned and uploaded my workbook for your perusal.

  1. Basic Logic Gates — Description, Workbook
  2. Combinational Circuits — Description, Workbook
  3. Flip Flops & Sequential Circuits — Description, Workbook
  4. Circuit Design Task — Description, Workbook
  5. Introduction to Microcontrollers and Assembly Language Programming — Description, Workbook
  6. AVR Assembly Language Programming — Description, Workbook
  7. AVR C Programming — Description, Workbook
  8. AVR I/O – Timer/Counter & Tone Generator — Description, Workbook
  9. AVR Interrupts & Serial I/O — Description, Workbook
